oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civil War cavalry carbine thimble
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is the model 1859 US cavalry carbine thimble. The thimble attached to the "D-ring" on the offside of the saddle. When mounted the trooper placed the muzzle of his carbine into the thimble to prevent the carbine from bouncing against the horse and therider. This example was probably never issued and was sold as surplus after the war.
